intro: Oldenlandia confusa, commonly known as the "Blue Mistflower," is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early fall. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, ditches, and along stream banks.
